result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovanni Marquez Vazquez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Jovanni Marquez Vazquez.  
Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a plea and sentencing date. 
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Jovanni Marquez Vazquez.  
Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Mother ( NV) appears via zoom.
Victim ( CK) appears via zoom.

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference tagging along with Case 22CF3186. 
Hearing held on pending matter and adjourned for further proceedings. This case to follow. . 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report ( defendant in custody) received and filed.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez not in court, in custody.  
Student intern Caroline Pelligrini supervised by Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense request an adjournment due to defendant pending felony matter ( 22CF3186), which is scheduled for a preliminary hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court, appear by video with attorney Connor Romenesko, appear by video.  Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judical notice to case 22CF2821. Sworn for the State:  Glendale Officer H. Sandler.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.
Oral No Contact Order with LB, SVB.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jovanni Marquez Vazquez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
